arm_group.description: Sedated and mechanically ventilated patients admitted to ICU

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study gas-exchange and respiratory mechanics variations to PEEP change will be
      correlated to CT lung morphological modifications assessed at different airway pressures (5,
      15, 30 and 45 cmH2O).

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Lung Recruitment and End-expiratory Lung Collapse in Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of acute lung injury/ acute respiratory distress syndrome

          -  Mechanical ventilation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

          -  Clinical diagnosis of pneumothorax

          -  Haemodynamic instability

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to ICU with diagnosis of ARDS who required mechanical ventilation

facility.name: Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Lung Recruitment and End-expiratory Lung Collapse in Patients With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome

overall_official.affiliation: Fondazione IRCCS Ca' Granda, Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico

primary_outcome.description: Aim of the study is to determine the relationship between the opening pressures (recruitment) and closing pressures (PEEP) in order to prevent the opening and closing of the lung parenchyma
primary_outcome.measure: Computer Tomography (CT) scan lung recruitment and CT lung weight

reference.citation: Gattinoni L, Caironi P, Cressoni M, Chiumello D, Ranieri VM, Quintel M, Russo S, Patroniti N, Cornejo R, Bugedo G. Lung recruitment in patients with the acute respiratory distress syndrome. N Engl J Med. 2006 Apr 27;354(17):1775-86.

Caironi P, Cressoni M, Chiumello D, Ranieri M, Quintel M, Russo SG, Cornejo R, Bugedo G, Carlesso E, Russo R, Caspani L, Gattinoni L. Lung opening and closing during ventilation of acute respiratory distress syndrome. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2010 Mar 15;181(6):578-86. Epub 2009 Nov 12.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
